item.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that the President is in violation of the War Powers Resolution regarding the use of United States Armed Forces in Libya, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.title: A joint resolution declaring that the President has exceeded his authority under the War Powers Resolution as it pertains to the ongoing military engagement in Libya.

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 68.

item.title: A joint resolution declaring that the President has exceeded his authority under the War Powers Resolution as it pertains to the ongoing military engagement in Libya.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Foreign Relations.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

item.name: Presidents and presidential powers, Vice Presidents

summary.text: Expresses the sense of Congress that the President should adhere to the War Powers Resolution and obtain specific statutory authorization for the use of U.S. Armed Forces in Libya within 60 days of initiating military action there, of which the President notified Congress on March 19, 2011, or terminate such action if such authorization is not obtained.

bill.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that the President should adhere to the War Powers Resolution and obtain specific statutory authorization for the use of United States Armed Forces in Libya.

item.title: Expressing the sense of Congress that the President should adhere to the War Powers Resolution and obtain specific statutory authorization for the use of United States Armed Forces in Libya.
Expressing the sense of Congress that the President should adhere to the War Powers Resolution and obtain specific statutory authorization for the use of United States Armed Forces in Libya.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
